name.japanese: パンクハザード研究所

keyEvents.title: Law Reveals Vergo's Identity in Prison Cell
keyEvents.description: Inside a prison cell in the laboratory, Law reveals Vergo's true identity as Doflamingo's subordinate to the imprisoned Straw Hats and Marines.
keyEvents.significance: The laboratory's prison becomes the setting for major revelations about the conspiracy.

keyEvents.title: Law Beaten by Vergo
keyEvents.description: Vergo brutally beats Law inside the laboratory.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the laboratory as a place of torture and cruelty.

keyEvents.title: Laboratory Sealed, Trapping G-5 Marines Outside
keyEvents.description: All entrances to the laboratory are sealed by Caesar's orders, leaving the G-5 Marines trapped outside with Smiley.
keyEvents.significance: The laboratory becomes a fortress, separating those inside from the deadly threat outside.

description: Caesar Clown's research facility on Punk Hazard where he conducts illegal experiments including human gigantification on kidnapped children. The laboratory contains prison cells, research rooms, and surveillance systems.
geography: A large building complex on the burning side of Punk Hazard island.
significance: The central location for the Punk Hazard arc's conflict, housing both the villain's operations and the imprisoned heroes.

keyEvents.title: Smiley Chases Zoro's Group Across the Island
keyEvents.description: The giant poisonous slime Smiley pursues Zoro, Sanji, Brook, and Kin'emon across Punk Hazard, attacking them with massive poisonous blobs.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the island as a dangerous battlefield where even powerful fighters must flee from certain threats.

keyEvents.title: Caesar Recaptures Children on the Island
keyEvents.description: Caesar appears on Punk Hazard to recapture the kidnapped children from Nami and Usopp using addictive candy.
keyEvents.significance: Shows how the island's different areas serve as locations for various plot threads.

description: A former government research facility that became a wasteland after a chemical weapon accident. The island is split between a burning side and a freezing side, now used by Caesar Clown for illegal experiments.
geography: An island in the New World split into two halves - one perpetually burning, one perpetually frozen - due to the battle between Akainu and Aokiji.
significance: The primary setting for the Punk Hazard arc, representing the dangers of unchecked scientific experimentation.

keyEvents.title: Parents Discover Children Were Kidnapped
keyEvents.description: On this island, desperate parents plead with Marine Commodore Yarisugi for help finding their missing children, only to be told they are dead based on Vergo's falsified reports.
keyEvents.significance: This location reveals the human cost of the conspiracy and shows how far-reaching Vergo's cover-up was.

keyEvents.title: Yarisugi's First Appearance
keyEvents.description: Marine Commodore Yarisugi appears on this island as the local Marine authority.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the island as the home of the kidnapped children's families.

description: An unnamed island in the New World where the children kidnapped by Caesar Clown originally lived with their families. The island has a Marine presence under Commodore Yarisugi.
geography: An island in the New World with a town and Marine base.
significance: Represents the victims' homeland and shows the broader impact of Caesar and Vergo's crimes beyond Punk Hazard.

trivia.fact: This is the island from which Caesar Clown kidnapped children for his gigantification experiments, claiming they were sick and needed treatment.
